title: Premium gold Dashboard redesign with animated energy background, Energy Capsules, portal score ring, and Future Projection section

requirements.summary: Replace the Dashboard’s blue–violet theme with a premium gold + dark jade + emerald/turquoise palette (ruby-red only for warnings) across surfaces while preserving all existing Dashboard functionality.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard no longer uses the blue–violet palette as the primary accent; the dominant accents match gold/jade/emerald/turquoise, and destructive/warning states remain ruby-red.
All newly introduced user-facing labels are in English (and still respect the existing German/English toggle where applicable).
No existing tracking inputs, calculations, or mutations on the Dashboard are removed or functionally altered.

file_operations.description: Update global theme tokens and utility classes to the premium gold + dark jade + emerald/turquoise palette, keeping ruby-red for destructive/warning, and refine glass/bokeh depth styling for Dashboard surfaces.

Adjust Tailwind extended colors/shadows/animations to align with the new premium palette (gold/jade/emerald/turquoise) while preserving destructive/ruby usage and existing utility class compatibility.
Replace blue–violet score/dial gradient helpers with gold/jade/emerald/turquoise equivalents used by Dashboard visuals (e.g., ScoreRing), keeping warning/destructive styling ruby-red.

Apply the new palette consistently within the Dashboard page layout and section wrappers (background, panels, borders, highlights, interactive states) without changing existing computations, inputs, or mutations.
Update ScoreRing visuals to use the new gold/jade/emerald/turquoise palette (remove blue–violet gradients) while keeping current data flow and behavior unchanged.

requirements.summary: Add a subtle animated gold energy background overlay (slow caustics/light-ray drift) on the Dashboard only, behind all content with pointer-events disabled.
acceptanceCriteria: A low-opacity animated overlay is visible behind Dashboard content and does not interfere with scrolling or clicking (pointer-events disabled).
The animation is subtle (slow drift, no rapid flashing) and performance-safe (no heavy JS animation loops required).
The effect is only present on Dashboard (or is safely reusable elsewhere without breaking other pages).

file_operations.description: Add fixed, pointer-events-none background overlay layers behind Dashboard content that render the generated textures and remain isolated to the Dashboard view.

Create/update CSS utility classes and keyframes for the subtle drift animation and low-opacity overlay styling using the generated asset frontend/public/assets/generated/gold-caustics-overlay.dim_2400x1350.png and the depth layer frontend/public/assets/generated/premium-bokeh-overlay.dim_2400x1350.png.
Add the required generated asset to the public assets folder and wire it into the Dashboard overlay styling.
Add the required generated asset to the public assets folder and wire it into the Dashboard overlay styling.

requirements.summary: Present routine sections on the Dashboard as futuristic glass ‘Energy Capsules’ with completion-based upward fill and glow that intensifies with completion, supporting at least gold and jade accent modes.
acceptanceCriteria: Each routine section is presented inside an EnergyCapsule-like container with glass styling and a completion fill animation tied to the existing completion computations in Dashboard.
Completion fill animates smoothly (no jump cuts) when values change, and the glow becomes more noticeable at higher completion (e.g., >70%).
EnergyCapsule supports at least two accent modes (e.g., gold for highlights and jade for health-related sections) and the chosen accent is reflected in fill/glow styling.

file_operations.description: Implement completion-driven fill via CSS variable (e.g., --fill-height) and apply accentMode classes (gold/jade) so fill + glow styling changes by mode while preserving existing child content rendering.

Update/extend Energy Capsule utility styles to provide glass capsule styling, smooth upward fill transition, and completion-based glow (stronger above ~70%), including separate gold and jade accent variants.

Wrap each existing routine section (Fasting, Sleep, Training, Nutrition, Body metrics, Supplements) in EnergyCapsule and map each to an appropriate accentMode (e.g., jade for health metrics, emerald/turquoise for nutrition/water, gold for highlights) using the existing completion computations already present in Dashboard.

requirements.summary: Upgrade the Dashboard score area into a ‘portal’ effect: subtle pulse, gold shimmer contours, and a thin rotating spark ring around the score visualization without layout shift.
acceptanceCriteria: The score ring visibly pulses subtly and uses gold shimmer accents rather than blue–violet gradients.
A separate thin rotating spark ring (or equivalent subtle rotating spark effect) is rendered around the score visualization.
The effect does not reduce text readability and does not cause layout shift.

file_operations.description: Add portal visuals: gentle pulse on the ring container, gold shimmer on contours, and a separate thin rotating spark ring layer (CSS/SVG) positioned absolutely to avoid layout shift.
Add/adjust keyframes and utility classes for portal pulse, contour shimmer, and slow spark-ring rotation tuned for subtle motion and readability (no rapid flashing).
Ensure score color and background gradient helpers return gold-forward portal-friendly colors (and avoid blue–violet) so ScoreRing shimmer/contours match the new palette.

requirements.summary: Implement the ‘Future Projection’ section on the Dashboard with exactly three panels (Biological Youth, Body Form, Energy & Focus), each showing a numeric value, trend indicator, and an elegant silhouette outline, using existing computed values only.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard displays a clearly labeled 'Future Projection' section containing exactly the three requested areas with value + trend + silhouette visual.
Trend indicators are visually consistent with the new palette (e.g., positive in jade/emerald, negative in ruby/destructive, neutral muted).
The section remains fully functional with existing computed values and does not require new backend data.

file_operations.description: Refine Future Projection panels to match the premium palette, ensure exactly the three requested panels, and update trend indicator coloring (positive jade/emerald, negative destructive/ruby, neutral muted) while keeping the existing German/English behavior.

Place the FutureProjectionSection in a dedicated, clearly separated Dashboard block (above the routine grid or equivalent) using the already computed biologicalAge/bodyForm/energyFocus and trends (no new backend data).
Update Future Projection panel styling utilities for premium glass depth and palette-consistent borders/highlights, and ensure the silhouette outline blends elegantly without harming readability.
Add the required generated asset to the public assets folder and ensure FutureProjectionSection renders it from frontend/public/assets/generated/future-silhouette-outline.dim_512x512.png.

requirements.summary: Add minimal, high-impact micro-animations to Dashboard interactions: smoother sliders, supplement completion wipe highlight, and a brief energy pulse on training save—without changing workflows or adding popups.
acceptanceCriteria: Sliders on Dashboard use smooth transitions (track/thumb/value changes feel continuous) without causing input lag.
Toggling a supplement completion triggers a subtle wipe/highlight animation on the affected list item.
When a training save action occurs, the training area shows a brief pulse animation and returns to normal automatically.

file_operations.description: Improve perceived slider fluidity by adding lightweight CSS transitions for visual track/thumb/value updates (no heavy JS animation loops) while preserving current onChange behavior and responsiveness.

Add a local UI-only animation trigger that applies the existing wipe/highlight class to the toggled supplement row when completion changes; keep all existing supplement mutations and language strings intact.
Add a UI-only pulse trigger hook/prop and apply a brief pulse class to the training section container upon successful save, without altering the training save workflow or backend calls.
Wire micro-animations into Dashboard interactions by passing any needed callbacks/flags to TrainingCard and ensuring slider/supplement interactions remain functionally unchanged.
Retune micro-animation CSS to the new premium palette (wipe highlight tint, training pulse glow color) and ensure animations are subtle, brief, and accessibility-friendly.
